alert.note: Alert for Bay; Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 10:21AM EDT until April 09 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Saginaw River At Saginaw affecting Saginaw and Bay Counties. .Dry conditions are forecast through the weekend, allowing the river level to crest on Friday then gradually recede to below flood stage this weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saginaw River At Saginaw. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Impact...At 17.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the access road behind houses on Riverside Drive from both ends. At 18.0 feet, Houses on Riverside Drive begin to flood. Wickes Park and Green Point Nature Area in Saginaw also flood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
